conclusion: Consider the motion of charged particles in electric and magnetic fields.
Key steps: calculate electric force, acceleration, velocity, and kinetic energy.
Given: mass m, charge q, initial velocity v, mass of second particle 2m, charge q, initial velocity v, magnetic field strength B, distance d.
Electric force acting on a charged particle is F_e = qE.
Acceleration of a charged particle in an electric field is a_e = F_e/m = qE/m.
Radius of the circular path of the particle is r = mv/qB.
Kinetic energy of a charged particle is E_k = 1/2 mv^2.
Calculate kinetic energy: E_k = 1/2 m (mv/qB)^2 = m/2qB v^2.
Final answer: kinetic energy E_k of the second charged particle when it leaves N is m/2qB v^2.
